Issues.Title: Add `@starting-style` variant
Issues.Body:
This PR adds support for `@starting-style` through the `starting:` variant.

`@starting-style` was [shipped in Chrome 117](https://chromestatus.com/feature/4515377717968896)

Further Reading:
- https://www.bram.us/2023/05/24/the-yellow-fade-technique-with-modern-css-using-starting-style/
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add `@starting-style` variant" (#12040)

Issues.Title: Add support for `text-wrap: pretty`
Issues.Body:
This PR adds support for `text-wrap: pretty` through the `text-pretty` utility.

`text-wrap: pretty` was [shipped in Chrome 117](https://chromestatus.com/feature/5145771917180928).

Unlike `text-wrap: balance`, where all lines are made to have equal-length, `text-wrap: pretty` prevents the final line from being excessively short. It serves as a value specifically designed to prevent widows without requiring additional formatting.

Further Reading:

- https://drafts.csswg.org/css-text-4/#valdef-text-wrap-style-pretty
- https://clagnut.com/blog/2424/

ref https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/pull/11320
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add support for `text-wrap: pretty`" (#12031)

Issues.Title: Getting `The `-_indent-px` class does not exist` error when `prefix: '_'` is set in tailwind config
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** 3.3.3 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** next.js **What version of Node.js are you using?** 18 **What browser are you using?** Chrome **What operating system are you using?** macOS **Reproduction URL** https://play.tailwindcss.com/flTOSJ38xV?file=css **Describe your issue** it's totally valid start CSS class name with `-_` ```css .-_foo { background: red; } ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Getting `The `-_indent-px` class does not exist` error when `prefix: '_'` is set in tailwind config" (#12033)

Issues.Title: I want to make tailwindcss.config.ts follow tsconfig compilerOptions
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "I want to make tailwindcss.config.ts follow tsconfig compilerOptions" (#12035)

Issues.Title: line-clamp and first-letter: doesn't work together
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
v 3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

What tailwind play is using

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

What tailwind play is using

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

MacOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/lt8kpsOSYS

**Describe your issue**

When I add `line-clamp` to an element the first-letter utility doesn't work anymore. In the example I am clamping a div and also try to make the first letter red.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "line-clamp and first-letter: doesn't work together" (#12030)

Issues.Title: Box shadow not working on ios
Issues.Body:
Since Iphone ios tends to mess box shadow on inputs, it is necessary to add "-webkit-appearance: none;" manually in css.
Does TailwindCSS comes with prebuilt css to fix this issue ?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Box shadow not working on ios" (#12022)

Issues.Title: justify-around isnot working in tailwindcss
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
v3.3.3
For example: v2.0.4


For example: postcss-cli 8.3.1, Next.js 10.0.9, webpack 5.28.0


**What browser are you using?**
edge
For example: Chrome, Safari, or N/A

**What operating system are you using?**

, Windows

--------------
I tried to use class justify-around, but it isnot working, so I needed to add it as style.
please fix it
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "justify-around isnot working in tailwindcss" (#12014)

Issues.Title: SvelteKit Tailwind installation is outdated
Issues.Body:
I just followed the svelteKit and tailwind docs https://tailwindcss.com/docs/guides/sveltekit and my VS Code editor does not recognize @tailwind and colors in "theme(colors.gray.100)".

I followed the docs consistently and installed the Tailwind Css IntelliSense extension.

How do I make these errors go away?

![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/144183087/7d295a00-2c9b-424a-9838-557ff29ee14a)
![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/144183087/7c658de4-376f-4ccc-a79b-e30f2c8f95c1)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "SvelteKit Tailwind installation is outdated" (#12008)

Issues.Title: Error: EMFILE: too many open files, open error with version 3.3.3
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

postcss: 0.11.0, postcss-cli: 10.1.0

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

18.4.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome, Edge, FireFox

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

Sorry unable to provide the reproduction url since our project is private. The error is not happening with tailwind version 3.3.2

**Describe your issue**

We have upgraded our project to tailwind 3.3.3 and we started getting this error

[Error: EMFILE: too many open files, open 
  errno: -4066,
  code: 'EMFILE',
  syscall: 'open',

The error is not happening with version 3.3.2

Thanks in advance for the help.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error: EMFILE: too many open files, open error with version 3.3.3" (#12003)

Issues.Title: Update rollup 3.28.0 ‚Üí 3.29.1 (minor)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è rollup (3.28.0 ‚Üí 3.29.1) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/rollup/rollup) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

3.29.1

3.29.1

2023-09-10

Bug Fixes

  • Fix time measurement of plugin hooks in watch mode (#5114)
  • Ensure accessing document.currentScript in import.meta.url returns correct results (#5118)

Pull Requests

  • #5114: fix(perf): avoid superfluous timer wrappings in watch mode (@ZhengLiu2825)
  • #5118: fix: access document.currentScript at the top level (@TrickyPi)
  • #5125: chore(deps): update actions/checkout action to v4 (@renovate[bot])
  • #5126: chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (@renovate[bot])
  • #5129: re-enbale repl-artefacts workflow for rollup-swc branch (@TrickyPi)

3.29.0

3.29.0

2023-09-06

Features

  • Add output.sourcemapFileNames option (#5105)
  • Add generic type parameter for api to Plugin type (#5112)

Bug Fixes

  • Ensure mutations of CustomEvent details are tracked (#5123)

Pull Requests

  • #5105: Added option to name sourcemap files, i.e. a output.sourcemapFileName‚Ä¶ (@atti187)
  • #5108: chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (@renovate[bot])
  • #5109: Docs: load full path of rollup.browser.js for Rollup V4 (@TrickyPi)
  • #5112: feat(types): add generic type for plugin api (@sxzz)
  • #5115: chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (@renovate[bot])
  • #5123: Deoptimize custom event detail (@lukastaegert)

3.28.1

3.28.1

2023-08-22

Bug Fixes

  • Ensure external files with relative import paths outside the target are rendered correctly (#5099)

Pull Requests

  • #5093: chore(deps): update dependency eslint-config-prettier to v9 (@renovate[bot])
  • #5094: chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (@renovate[bot])
  • #5099: Fix resolution of relative external files outside target directory (@lukastaegert)
  • #5101: chore(deps): update dependency lint-staged to v14 (@renovate[bot])
  • #5102: chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (@renovate[bot])

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 22 commits:

  • 3.29.1
  • Ignore wasm files when linting
  • fix: access document.currentScript at the top level (#5118)
  • fix(perf): avoid superfluous timer wrappings in watch mode (#5114)
  • re-enbale repl-artefacts workflow for rollup-swc branch (#5129)
  • chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (#5126)
  • chore(deps): update actions/checkout action to v4 (#5125)
  • 3.29.0
  • Deoptimize custom event detail (#5123)
  • Added option to name sourcemap files, i.e. a output.sourcemapFileName‚Ä¶ (#5105)
  • chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (#5115)
  • feat(types): add generic type for plugin api (#5112)
  • Docs: load full path of rollup.browser.js for Rollup V4 (#5109)
  • chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (#5108)
  • 3.28.1
  • Comment out codecov token for now
  • chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (#5102)
  • chore(deps): update dependency lint-staged to v14 (#5101)
  • Fix resolution of relative external files outside target directory (#5099)
  • chore(deps): update dependency eslint-config-prettier to v9 (#5093)
  • chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (#5094)
  • Fix CI npm versions
#### ‚ú≥Ô∏è @‚Äãswc/core (1.3.76 ‚Üí 1.3.84) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/swc-project/swc) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/swc-project/swc/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

1.3.84 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es/codegen) Emit leading comments for ExprStmt (#7916) (2da5895)

  • (es/codegen) Use emitAssertForImportAttributes (#7936) (dac8888)

  • (es/compat) Visit assign expr in generator (#7932) (97068e1)

1.3.83 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (css/modules) Aggregate class names when composes is chained. (#7917) (0db25a2)

  • (es/module) Revert #7901 (#7906) (85d6e9b)

  • (es/module) Fix jsc.paths for projects using pnpm (#7918) (a86e9f3)

Features

  • (es/codegen) Add an option to print assert for import attributes (#7914) (ee75756)

1.3.82 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (common) Fix logic for excluding FileName from source maps (#7900) (aa64955)

  • (es/module) Make jsc.paths fully resolve TypeScript files (#7901) (c714dd2)

  • (es/resolver) Correctly resolve global value (#7893) (2db10e9)

1.3.81 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es/codegen) Fix placing of comments of yield arguments (#7858) (122d14c)

  • (es/compat) Apply transforms for explicit resource management (#7881) (3180e68)

  • (es/compat) Make SwitchCase handler of block-scoping stateless (#7888) (4b33d41)

  • (es/dep-graph) Analyze import type children (#7883) (057bd5f)

  • (es/minifier) Report is_fn_local even if var is hoisted (#7876) (87a47bf)

  • (es/module) Don't create absolute paths for jsc.paths on Windows (#7892) (5fbc251)

  • (swc-info) Use correct path while getting local package versions (#7872) (67afaf1)

Features

  • (es) Add an option to disable builtin transforms (#7873) (71d01ec)

  • (es/ast) Support import attributes proposal (#7868) (4d3fcb8)

  • (es/preset-env) Update data (#7882) (a97d8b4)

  • (swc-info) Add a CLI to help issue reporting (#7871) (d6952ea)

Miscellaneous Tasks

  • (deps) Update memchr (#7891) (01cbd6e)- general: Use textarea for swc-info (eed2903)

Performance

  • (es/transforms) Remove wrong parallelism (#7889) (a505012)

Refactor

  • (es/minifier) Remove mutated and mutation_by_call_count (#7890) (8db968a)

1.3.80 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es/module) Fix logic for exact matches in jsc.paths (#7860) (52a1ee7)

  • (es/module) Don't resolve as node_modules from TscResolver (#7866) (11ebae1)

Miscellaneous Tasks

  • general: Remove unused files (e47f1c2)

1.3.79 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es) Fix default value of jsc.minify.format.comments (#7853) (64e51d3)

  • (es/minifier) Don't inline properties if the var is not fn-local (#7839) (7fe01e6)

  • (es/minifier) Don't remove exports (#7856) (ae8cd94)

  • (es/module) Make jsc.paths work for a nest.js app (#7852) (d33a973)

Features

  • (css/ast) Support @scope at-rule (#7837) (a34f359)

Miscellaneous Tasks

  • (ci) Fix CI (#7857) (854e2e7)

Refactor

  • (common) Mark some methods of Input unsafe (#7848) (c657324)

  • (es/helpers) Move packages for monorepo (#7833) (1ab406c)

  • (es/minifier) Pre-calculate reassigned (#7832) (65db1ba)

  • (es/types) Extract @swc/types as a small, reusable package (#7834) (f713f1b)

1.3.78 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es/codegen) Add quotes to property names when ascii_only is true (#7820) (04921f3)

  • (es/compat) Remove wrong logic for object patterns in object_rest (#7788) (3766a7c)

  • (es/minifier) Preserve cooked while compressing template literals (#7773) (05990a9)

  • (es/minifier) Abort seq inliner if var is not fn_local or reassigned (#7804) (f8ca366)

  • (es/minifier) Preserve more analysis data upon inlining (#7823) (31de19e)

Features

  • (es/module) Improve error message about relative jsc.baseUrl (#7827) (9099883)

Refactor

  • (common) Make ahash optional (#7816) (981d7b1)

  • (es/parser) Remove needless unsafe (#7818) (8b809db)- general: Use ahash from swc_common in more places (#7815) (b43e38d)

1.3.77 (from changelog)

Bug Fixes

  • (es) Resolve jsc.baseUrl for .swcrc specified by --config-file (#7801) (fe1ca26)

  • (es/compat) Revert #7610 (#7813) (42dec55)

  • (es/parser) Revert lexer fix for << (#7807) (e527c12)

Features

  • (es/ast) Expose Archived types (#7811) (478fa47)

Refactor

  • (es/parser) Don't attempt to handle shebangs in read_token_number_sign (#7803) (5e7834a)

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by more commits than we can show here.

Issues.Title: Update postcss 8.4.28 ‚Üí 8.4.29 (patch)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è postcss (8.4.28 ‚Üí 8.4.29) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/postcss/postcss/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

8.4.29

  • Fixed Node#source.offset (by @idoros).
  • Fixed docs (by @coliff).

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 6 commits:

  • Release 8.4.29 version
  • Update dependencies
  • Merge pull request #1879 from idoros/ido/fix-location-offset
  • fix: node end offset
  • Merge pull request #1875 from coliff/patch-1
  • Fix links on README.md

Issues.Title: Tracking classes issue
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Astro


**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Describe your issue**

tracking-tighter
tracking-tight
classes should be positive (+) and are negative (-)

same with 
-tracking-tighter
-tracking-tight
classes should be negative (-) and are positive (+)

--and having -tracking-normal (-0em) is redundant to tracking-normal (0em)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tracking classes issue" (#11989)

Issues.Title: Can't set a border-width by CSS var like border-[--my-css-var]
Issues.Body:
This will result in the `border-color` being set.

Issues.Title: Preflight: "Cursor" not Added
Issues.Body:

v3.3.3

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v18.8.0

**What browser are you using?**
Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**
Windows 11

**Describe your issue**
Hello, I'm here to report an issue. on Preflight "Cursor" property didn't get reset. like if I hover on "a" tag, the cursor will turn into the pointer.
as Tailwind Preflight should reset lot of things this one is one of them too. tysm

Issues.Title: No Autocomplete
Issues.Body:
**What version of VS Code are you using?**

v1.81.1

**What version of Tailwind CSS IntelliSense are you using?**

v0.10.0

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3.3

**What package manager are you using?**

npm

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Tailwind config**

```ts
import type { Config } from 'tailwindcss'

const config: Config = {
  content: [
    './src/pages/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx,mdx}',
    './src/components/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx,mdx}',
    './src/app/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx,mdx}',
  ],
  theme: {
    extend: {
      backgroundImage: {
        'gradient-radial': 'radial-gradient(var(--tw-gradient-stops))',
        'gradient-conic':
          'conic-gradient(from 180deg at 50% 50%, var(--tw-gradient-stops))',
      },
    },
  },
  plugins: [],
}
export default config
```

**VS Code settings**

```json
{
    "translation.baidu.appId": "########",
    "translation.baidu.appKey": "########",
    "editor.detectIndentation": false,
    "explorer.sortOrder": "type",
    "editor.tabSize": 2,
    "javascript.updateImportsOnFileMove.enabled": "always",
    "workbench.editorAssociations": {
      "*.docx": "default"
    },
    "git.suggestSmartCommit": false,
    "files.autoSave": "afterDelay"
}
```

**Reproduction URL**

[github](https://github.com/fengluo2/test1)

**Describe your issue**

No Autocomplete.

Issues.Title: Can someone tell me what is causing this animation to behave like this on iOS and iPadOS.
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
v 3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
Next.js 13.4.19

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v 19.7.0

**What browser are you using?**
Chrome, Safari

**What operating system are you using?**
Windows, iOS, iPadOS

**Reproduction URL**
https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/confident-brown-4p8y7l

https://4p8y7l-5173.csb.app/

**Describe your issue**
There is some weird glitch or something that is happening when I click on the toggle button "loading: true". The loading bug occurs only on iPad, iOS, (not tested on MacOS). It works fine on Windows and Android browsers. I teseted on Chrome and Safari on iOS and iPadOS and Chrome on Windows and Android.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can someone tell me what is causing this animation to behave like this on iOS and iPadOS." (#11959)

Issues.Title: ring ignores opacity on dark color scheme
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

sveltekit

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v20.3.0

**What browser are you using?**

Firefox, Edge

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/PwsDG36K97

**Describe your issue**

I don't know if this intended or is a bug;
but when using `ring` with `ring-opacity` on a dark color scheme,
the dark variant ignores the `ring-opacity`, but works if `dark:ring-opacity` is present
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ring ignores opacity on dark color scheme" (#11950)

Issues.Title: Split background color While I only have one color
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.3.3 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** postcss-cli 8.4.28 Next.js 13.4.19, webpack 5.88.2 **What version of Node.js are you using?** v20.3.0 **What browser are you using?** Chrome, edge, Arc **What operating system are you using?** macOS **Reproduction URL** A Tailwind Play link or public GitHub repo that includes a minimal reproduction of the bug. **Please do not link to your actual project**, what we need instead is a _minimal_ reproduction in a fresh project without any unnecessary code. This means it doesn't matter if your real project is private/confidential, since we want a link to a separate, isolated reproduction anyways. [See here](https://play.tailwindcss.com/mPWKwBxGTB?file=config) **Describe your issue** As you can see the background is split in two color while the body has only custom one named bg-dark-50. If you put a border 1px solid everywhere, or add opacity bg-dark-50/90 or even disable margin-0 on layout.css it fixes the problem. You can even just change the color. But unfortunately that's my background color ^^ I tried with different dark colors some work other don't. For example #1A1A1A has no problem. Hope it helps. Sure it could help me. Thank you for your time. :) Edit: You need a screen that can display Rec 709 or almost adobe RGB 1998. For example Apple RGB or lowest are not wide enough to display full colors
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Split background color While I only have one color" (#11946)

Issues.Title: `matchUtilities` can't handle nested values
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`matchUtilities` can't handle nested values" (#11942)

Issues.Title: Add `forced-colors-adjust` utilities
Issues.Body: Adds utilities for [`forced-colors-adjust`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/forced-color-adjust)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add `forced-colors-adjust` utilities" (#11931)

Issues.Title: Add scripting variants
Issues.Body: This adds two variants for the [`scripting`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media/scripting) media query. `noscript` for when JavaScript is disabled and `scripting` for when it's enabled.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add scripting variants" (#11929)

Issues.Title: Free components render extra large!
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/11909
Originally posted by **BaltWeb** August 26, 2023 I am new to Tailwind and would like to start by using the free of charge components, with code readily available to code and use from the Tailwind UI page. Taking the first Application UI free component as example to explain the issue, this : https://tailwindui.com/components/application-ui/application-shells/stacked Coping and pasting the HTML code to render, on running it does not render correctly; and is displayed very large in the browser, please see P1 & P2 attached. This issue persists when running via the terminal / localhost and also when run with VS Code, Apache and Codepen. I also tested for this issue on a different pc using Codepen only; finding the same large rendering issue also. Further to the above, I have gone further and tried some of the other free components available, with the same rendering issue also! Please let me know what may be the root cause of the issue and how to resolve it?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Free components render extra large!" (#11923)

Issues.Title: [Issue] font-[inherit] is assigned to font-family
Issues.Body:
Hey folks.

Today I tried to `font-[inherit]` (with prose), and saw that the generated style is font-family.
I'd think more relevant to have it in font-weight. 
WDYT?

More generaly, how have you though this kind of conflict?

Thanks.

In the commit, the failing test.

See you. 
üëã
Mathieu.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[Issue] font-[inherit] is assigned to font-family" (#11917)

Issues.Title: Update lightningcss 1.21.5 ‚Üí 1.21.7 (patch)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è lightningcss (1.21.5 ‚Üí 1.21.7) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/parcel-bundler/lightningcss)
Release Notes

1.21.6

Fixes

  • Parse the @starting-style rule
  • Fix custom top-level style blocks when not nested
  • Remove const enum in Features TS type definition
  • Change Buffer to Uint8Array in TS types for non-Node compatibility
  • Fix a typo in media_query
  • Fix serializing text-size-adjust
  • Fix prefixing duplicate backdrop-filter properties
  • Fix background-clip prefixing
  • Don't put unknown pseudo elements in an :is()
  • Make a node specific wasm build that initializes synchronously for stackblitz
  • Add freebsd build

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Sorry, we couldn't find anything useful about this release. --- ![Depfu Status](https://depfu.com/badges/edd6acd35d74c8d41cbb540c30442adf/stats.svg) [Depfu](https://depfu.com) will automatically keep this PR conflict-free, as long as you don't add any commits to this branch yourself. Issues.Title: Free components render extra large!
Issues.Body:
I am new to Tailwind and would like to start by using the free of charge components, with code readily available to code and use from the Tailwind UI page.  Taking the first Application UI free component as example to explain the issue, this :

https://tailwindui.com/components/application-ui/application-shells/stacked

Coping and pasting the HTML code to render, on running it does not render correctly; and is displayed very large in the browser, please see P1 & P2 attached. 

This issue persists when running via the terminal / localhost and also when run with VS Code, Apache and Codepen. I also tested for this issue on a different pc using Codepen only; finding the same large rendering issue also. 

Further to the above, I have gone further and tried some of the other free components available, with the same rendering issue also!

Please let me know what may be the root cause of the issue and  how to resolve it?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Free components render extra large!" (#11908)

Issues.Title: Expose variants to matchUtilities
Issues.Body:
Hello Tailwind team! I didn't ask first about this one because it's so tiny; I hope that's OK!

I'm in the process of writing a fluid type utility and encountered an unusual situation where I wanted to know from within the utility if it was being used with a screen variant, so I could change some values accordingly. I figured it would make most sense to pass the `variants` through to `matchUtilities`/`matchComponents` in the `extra` object that already holds `modifiers`. I can't think of any negative side effects, because the variants still get applied. For simplicity, I'm only passing through the variant names for now but I could potentially expand it to perhaps show selectors as well (similar to `context.getVariants()`). Any thoughts?

Thanks!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Expose variants to matchUtilities" (#11906)
